image.altText: Hand holding a magnifying glass over Tasmanian Government letterhead.

props.synopsis: The activities of Tasmania's 70 registered lobbyists, who act on behalf of paying clients to get results from the government, were to be made public from July 1, but that's no longer going to happen.

title.children: Tasmanians were weeks away from seeing how lobbyists operate â€” but not anymore

image.altText: Aerial render of a medical facility and car park.

props.synopsis: Two brothers from Tasmania's north-west coast are transforming a derelict university site into an all-inclusive health hub, with 16 permanent service providers.

title.children: What to expect from Burnie's new health hub

image.altText: a balding man in police uniform

props.synopsis: Police have charged a 46-year-old man with murder, attempted murder and aggravated assault after a police officer was fatally shot in Tasmania's north-west on Monday.

title.children: Man, 46, charged with murder after death of Tasmanian police officer

image.altText: Labor announces Renew Tas, a new urban development body, 19 June 2025 2025-06-19

props.synopsis: After being "open-minded" at the start of the week, Labor leader Dean Winter has now given unequivocal support for the proposed Macquarie Point stadium in Hobart and for it to be approved through fast-track enabling legislation.

title.children: 'The only way': Labor locks in Mac Point stadium via special legislation

image.altText: bruce lehrmann walking outside court

props.synopsis: Former political staffer Bruce Lehrmann has pleaded not guilty to one count of motor vehicle stealing in Tasmania.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann pleads not guilty to stealing car in Tasmania

image.altText: A composite image of three middle-aged men.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian coroner concludes "driver error" was the cause of four deaths over two years during Targa Tasmania's annual rally race.

title.children: 'Driver error' a common factor in Targa rally deaths, coroner finds

image.altText: Various houses on a hill in Hobart

props.synopsis: Western Australia surges past 3 million people with the fastest growing population in the country while Tasmania sits at the bottom of the pack, losing thousands to interstate.

title.children: Tasmania records slowest population growth, as WA hits 3 million

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing to the stadium.

title.children: A $2,000 IVF subsidy and all the other promises from the Tasmanian election

image.altText: Have your say for the Tasmanian election.

props.synopsis: We want to know what issues matter most to you and what you want us to find out as Tasmania goes to another election.

title.children: Your Say: Tell us what matters to you this Tasmanian election

image.altText: family sit in the backyard on chairs and blankets with drinks and kids on swings

props.synopsis: As more Australians rely on family to enter the housing market, the backyard of mum and dad is becoming an appealing option.Â

title.children: As property prices rise, these families are thinking outside the box

props.synopsis: Over the AFLW off-season, Hawthorn's Tilly Lucas-Rodd underwent top surgery, a gender-affirming procedure that involves the removal of breast tissue in essentially a double mastectomy.Â

title.children: 'Huge dysphoria': First current AFLW player undergoes top surgery

image.altText: A red and white plane takes off into the sky with lights in the distance

props.synopsis: India's aviation regulator had warned the airline about a number of safety issues involving other planes in its fleet before last week's fatal crash.

title.children: Air India warned over safety breaches by aviation regulator

image.altText: Sussan Ley press conference smile

props.synopsis: To the extent anyone is paying attention, Sussan Ley has made a better start than many, including some Liberals, had expected.

title.children: Sussan Ley isn't dealing with the media like Peter Dutton did

image.altText: Transmission lines.

props.synopsis: Decisions by the Queensland government to extend the life of publicly-owned coal fired power stations beyond 2035, expand gas exploration and call in certain wind farm projects has raised concerns.

title.children: 'Energy policy chaos' in Queensland causing uncertainty among investors

image.altText: large, orange mushroom cloud takes up the evening sky over a woman standing outside her house

props.synopsis: From Trump's family business monetising the president's name again to a volcanic eruption affecting up to 14,000 travellers, it was another big week in news. Test yourself on what you remember.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: New Trump merchandise, a volcanic eruption and the annual G7 summit

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.Â

props.synopsis: The Victorian Liberal Party's administrative committee has voted to loan $1.55 million to former leader John Pesutto to pay his legal costs to MP Moira Deeming.

title.children: Victorian Liberals vote to save John Pesutto from bankruptcy

image.altText: A woman with a 7 News microphone in front of her face.

props.synopsis: Ms Patterson's lawyer has told the jury in her triple-murder trial she emerged "unscathed" from cross-examination, as his closing address came to an end.

title.children: Erin Patterson's lawyer urges jury to reject 'convoluted' triple-murder case

image.altText: Fire engulfs a large double storey home with flames leaping into the air at night.

props.synopsis: Fire Rescue Victoria says the St Georges Road home collapsed due to the intensity of the fire, which is being treated as suspicious.

title.children: Blazing fire destroys mansion in Toorak

image.altText: Emory University Hospital in Atlanta, Georgia.

props.synopsis: Adriana Smith was pronounced brain dead in February but due to Georgia abortion laws, doctors say they were forced to keep her on life support for months.Â

title.children: Brain-dead US woman kept alive to support pregnancy dies after c-section

image.altText: Man with white hair in black sailing jacket and hat, holding frame of steam boat

props.synopsis: A Wollongong man who has spent the past six years building a 20th-century steamboat in his shed has received a huge send-off during his maiden voyage.Â

title.children: Sick of watching TV, man builds steamboat in backyard

image.altText: Queens of the Stone Age frontman Josh Homme inside the Paris Catacombs.

props.synopsis: It's been Queens of the Stone Age frontman Josh Homme's life-long dream to become the first band to (legally) play in the Paris Catacombs. He wasn't going to let emergency surgery ruin a passion project two decades in the making.

title.children: How Josh Homme overcame illness to play for six million dead souls

image.altText: Daria Kasatkina clenches her fist

props.synopsis: Australia will host the next Billie Jean King Cup tennis tie in Tasmania, with Daria Kasatkina hoping to be on board for the first time.

title.children: Kasatkina keen on Billy Jean King Cup bow for Australia

image.altText: A person holds a can of tear gas.

props.synopsis: In the haze of gas and smoke, it can be hard to make sense of the chaos on Los Angeles streets. This is what it looks like when a progressive city in Trump's America is forced to turn on itself.

title.children: On the skirmish line, Donald Trump's troops meet the LA resistance

image.altText: A dead mahi-mahi fish with a blue dorsal fin.

props.synopsis:
The deadly micro algal bloom that has killed millions of marine creatures along South Australia's coastline continues to wreak havoc and cause "complete ecosystem failure from the bottom up".

Â

title.children: Wintry conditions fail to wash away SA's devastating algal bloom

image.altText: Three women and two children pictured outside a suburban swimming pool

props.synopsis: Residents in Heidelberg West are fighting for their local pool, with Banyule council to vote next week on whether to de-commission it. The council is proposing to build a library and other public facilities in its place, but residents won't give up without a fight.

title.children: Council proposal to demolish 'worst performing' pool on historic Olympic site

image.altText: Iranian flags fly as fire and smoke rise from an Israeli attack on an oil depot in Tehran

props.synopsis: Authorities in Iran have regularly restricted internet access for the country's roughly 90 million people since last week.

title.children: Iranians 'terrified' as internet blacked out amid Israeli strikes

image.altText: A man sits in front of a store.

props.synopsis: While Israel's war with Iran continues, Gazans are begging for help, saying their suffering is being ignored because of the new conflict.

title.children: 'The massacres continue in silence': Gazans fear being forgotten amid focus on Iran

image.altText: Drone shot of water and port surrounding a steelwork factory

props.synopsis: Following the first creditors' meeting, administrators of Whyalla Ports have revealed the company owes at least $194 million to various creditors.Â

title.children: Administrators reveal staggering debts of Whyalla Ports

image.altText: The entrance of a court house.

props.synopsis: The state's busiest courthouse, Downing Centre, was shut down due to a burst water main in Sydney's CBD earlier this week.

title.children: Damage from burst water main to keep Sydney courthouse closed for weeks

image.altText: Daryl Mundy

props.synopsis: A driver involved in a CBD car crash with a SA Police sergeant has called for greater oversight of cases where police are under investigation.

title.children: Crash involving SA Police sergeant prompts calls for more oversight

image.altText: A satellite GIF of clouds moving over the Australian continent between March 13 and March 31

props.synopsis: The areas over the ocean where storm clouds form have dwindled by up to 3 per cent in the past two decades, new research led by NASA shows.

title.children: Earth's shrinking cloud cover may hold the key to climate mysteryÂ

image.altText: PALM scheme workers picking celery and placing it on a conveying belt for processing.

props.synopsis: The NSW inquiry into the risk of slavery for temporary migrant workers hears from a doctor who says many women are choosing to have abortions to stay in Australia.Â

title.children: Women choosing abortions to keep work visas, slavery inquiry told

image.altText: An external shot of a fire station in Bendigo

props.synopsis: The opening of the new $5.6 million Country Fire Authority fire station in Bendigo has been delayed since February because the station failed a water pressure compliance test.

title.children: $5.6m Bendigo fire station useless because water pressure too low

image.altText: A young woman in high-vis smiles.

props.synopsis: Where are all the tradies? The construction industry says there's a massive shortage and it comes down to young people being told they have to go to university.

title.children: Why is there a 'massive shortage' of tradies?
